Author: wordswillwrite

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,051Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 12

entry.title: When Darkness Meets the Light
entry.summary:
Author: YairPL

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,043Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 22

Summary: One year after donning the cowl, Bruce Wayne is no hero. Batman is a specter of vengeance and fury, an unstable project channeling the trauma of a child still screaming in an alleyway. His mission is a self-destructive obsession, and Gotham, a black hole deserving to be purged with fire. Clark Kent, on the other hand, bears the weight of a power he believes he owes to the universe. His invincibility is not a gift, but a shield that must stand before all the pain of others, a cosmic guilt that drives him to save even those who do not want to be saved. When the Daily Planet reporter is assigned to cover Bruce Wayne's charity gala, a clash of ideologies tears away both their masks. Clark sees the deep open wound behind the playboy. Bruce feels for the first time truly seen. This is the story of how light does not always blind the darkness; sometimes, it sits beside it in silence and offers to heal its wounds. It is the journey of two men meeting at the precipice: one learning to be a hero, and the other learning to be human. And from the fragile bridge of understanding they build, the legend will be born.

entry.title: Sundays, Fridays, and Other Things We Didn’t Name
entry.summary:
Author: NightTwink73

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,290Chapters: 6/12Kudos: 14

Summary: Bruce Wayne’s life begins to reorganize itself around small, unintentional rituals: dinners on Sundays, movies on Fridays, a child who climbs where he shouldn’t and smiles like sunlight.Clark Kent fits into those spaces so easily it’s almost dangerous. Misunderstandings bloom. Feelings go unnamed.And somewhere between quiet nights, shared meals, and things no one quite knows how to say, a family starts to take shape.

entry.title: Even If We Both Break Down
entry.summary:
Author: Holdt

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,712Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 14

Summary: Bruce Wayne is the world's greatest detective. He can solve any crime, track any criminal, predict any outcome. But when it comes to love, he only knows one equation: caring equals loss.Now Clark's patience is wearing thin, and Bruce is finally forced to confront what he's been cataloguing all along: you can't protect someone by making them feel worthless. Sometimes the only thing more terrifying than losing someone is realizing you're losing them by choice.A character study about apologizing, about learning to be present instead of perfect, and about two men figuring out that love isn't a tactical problem to be solved—it's a choice to be made, again and again, even when the math says it's safer to run.

entry.title: Power
entry.summary:
Author: ope-uh-oh (shortjacketlongskirt)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 126,387Chapters: 25/?Kudos: 251

Summary: “Oh, you do like to flirt, don’t you?” Lex accused almost playfully, if not for the sharklike emptiness in his eyes. Bruce sat back as the appetizer plates were taken away and replaced with the entrée: filet mignon in a mushroom gravy, served with truffles, asparagus, and black garlic potatoes. He couldn’t help but think Clark would have appreciated this. And he desperately wished he was here with him rather than Vicki. He flashed a playful grin at Lex. “Flirting is what makes the world go round, Lex. What is that quote attributed to Oscar Wilde? ‘Everything in the world is about sex except sex, which is about power’. It applies to everything. Make people think you want them, and you’ve got the whole world in your hands.” After years of living in the closet, trying to ignore the truth, Bruce is finally cornered and is forced to come out in a very public way. This leads to a series of challenges, blending his public and private life in way he can’t escape.

entry.title: As Though the Sun Will Never Set
entry.summary:
Author: HeavenlyVolley

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 264,538Chapters: 20/65Kudos: 571

Summary: Bruce Wayne has done something to get him sent to live with the Kents, he thought it would be boring (It is), but he soon finds himself caught between something dangerous and too unnatural. There are factions moving in to claim his prize, his newly found trump card and he's not ready to let it go. Enter Clark, the soft-spoken Kansas farm boy, just a little too wholesome, a little too comfortable with cows and crickets and just a little too strong for his own good. As Bruce enters the plotters and begins weaving his web of seduction and treachery, mundanity seems further and further away, slipping through Clark's fingers. OR The one in which they are both trapped and enslaved by Clark's growing sexual desire and his alien physiology. (They have a lot of sex, sometimes, Bruce doesn't or can't consent) oh, and major feels too, I guess.
